Golden Kitchen, Beverly Hills.
The person in charge of the establishment's platform got a ping on his computer, as a new order came in.
He checked the order and its total cost, and confirmed if the person had made the payment. After the confirmation, he decided to print out the order and take it to the kitchen staffs.
As he walked to the kitchen, he curiously checked the address the client inputted for the home delivery. From the client's name in the transaction receipt, he knew that the person was new. And he was very curious to know where the person was ordering from.
His eyes moved down and he smiled when he saw the name.
"Bellemere Mansion. What a fancy sounding name," he smiled.
The next moment, his step paused as his eyes widened in shock and realisation.
"Bellemere Mansion. Wait... isn't that the mansion in the news?" He muttered to himself.
The name of the property, Bellemere Mansion, has been in the news after it was sold to a mysterious buyer. And everyone is curious to know who this mysterious buyer is. Especially people in his line of work and those that write online articles.
The staffer looked at the address once again to confirm, and the name of the client.
"Liam... Is this the guy?"
The staffer already aware of what he has to do, immediately walked to the manager's office. He knocked on the door and opened it, without receiving permission.
"What the hell, Damien?!" The male manager looked at the person that intruded into his office.
"Sorry, sir, but you might want to look at this order. It just came in. It's for Bellemere Mansion. Under the name Liam. I think we've got something big here," Damien said, giving the slip to manager.
The manager was quite annoyed with Damien and was about to scold him but when he heard what he said, he pivoted from annoyance to sharp curiosity.
He reached out and picked up the slip, and went through it. Just like Damien, his eyes widened in shock when he saw the address and name.
"Liam... Bellemere Mansion... Are you sure that it's really the owner? It might be just someone posing," he said in a low voice.
"I doubt it, sir. You know how things are in the Platinum Triangle. Who would dare use such a high profile property to pose? They would only be trying to get themselves killed," Damien replied.
"That's true," the manager nodded slowly.
Damien was right. In Beverly Hills, Bel-Air and Holmby Hills—the Platinum Triangle society, claiming a famous residence without the credentials would be social and financial suicide. No one would dare to do that. Especially in an elite area in LA.
"I guess we have a new VIP client. Make sure to tag him in the system," he instructed, "I will oversee this order and make sure it reflects the best of our services."
Damien nodded and left the office. The manager pressed the intercom on his desk and called for the establishment's most trusted delivery personnel, and told him to wait for him.
After he did that, he stood up and went to the kitchen.
"Chef, we have a very special VVIP order. Take very special care of it," he said, as he handed the order slip to the head chef.
The chef looked at the order and he saw the address. He smiled in realisation and immediately got to work. He understood that this was a chance for him to show off his skill and secure themselves a very reputable customer.
He made the meal, pouring everything he had into it — a performance-level effort that turned cooking into art, and the manager oversaw everything. After he was done, the kitchen assistants diligently packaged the meal and securely loaded it into the delivery car.
"Ben, drive carefully. Also, if possible, try to get a view of the person's face. A picture would be better but be discreet about it. Don't be disrespectful," the manager said to the delivery personnel.
He's just trying to gather a bit of information about the so called "mysterious buyer".
In elite business circles, staff gossip and low-key intel gathering isn't uncommon — especially when a mysterious billionaire suddenly orders food from a newly purchased megamansion.
Since he had already told Ben to not be disrespectful, it was enough to tell the delivery driver that he wasn't being sent to act like paparazzi. He's just being curious while maintaining boundaries
"I got it, boss," Ben said and got into the restaurant-branded Toyota Prius. He started the engine and drove off to the delivery address.
As he watched the back of the car fade into the distance, the manger muttered to himself, "If this goes well, we might just secure the most valuable client we've ever had."

chapters.title: Chapter 24: Group’s Reaction
chapters.content:
Chapter 24 - Group's Reaction
Later that night—Lana's room
After a chaotic and emotionally draining day, she could finally rest. She collapsed into her soft, pink bed and smiled tiredly.
Immediately, the first thing that came to her mind was what happened at the store today. She'd met Liam earlier that day—and he'd casually splurged more than $100,000. And she found out that he's the mysterious buyer of the property that has been hot in the news for the whole day.
Liam. Just who is he really? What sort of monstrous family background does he have to be able to easily afford a property of $70m+? Just how rich is he?
She had these questions and more going through her head, but she couldn't get an answer to any of them.
She sighed tiredly and rolled over on the bed, snuggling herself into it and making herself more comfortable.
Her phone buzzed and she picked it up from the nightstand. She saw that someone had send a message to their group chat, Chaos Corner.
She suddenly thought of something and smiled. She opened the group chat and sent a message.
"Guys, guess who I saw today"
Kristie: "Who?!"
Matt: "Come on, just tell us. Don't keep us waiting in suspense."
Stacy: "Tell us, Lana."
Others: "Yeah."
Lana shook her head, smiling from ear to ear, as she read their messages. She decidednkt to keep them in suspense any longer, as she sent another message.
"Liam."
Stacy: "Liam? Where?"
"Rodeo Drive."
Stacy: "Ohhh..."
"Guess what happened."
Matt: "Come on! Just tell us already!"
Harper: "It's already obvious what she's doing 🤣🤣"
Alex: "Tsk. Tsk. I had no idea when our sweet Lana became so evil. Who influenced her? I'm suspecting someone"
Kristie: "Come on, girl. Spill!!!"
Lana giggled when she saw their reaction. Stacy and Elise love doing this, but she has no idea this was how good it feels.
She smiled, as she typed her message.
"He bought some clothes and stuffs from my mom's store that totalled more than $100,000."
Matt: "He's splurging. Wow!"
Alex: "That's a lot of money to spend on clothes in a go. Bro is really loaded. Makes me wonder if he's actually the same Liam."
Elise: "He probably changed his wardrobe or something."
Lana smiled and took a deep breath when she saw their messages. She wonder how they will react when she drops the bomb.
She was about to type out what she learned about Liam, when Alex sent a message.
"Talking about people with hidden identities. Someone with a mysterious and hidden identity bought one of the biggest properties in the country."
Elise: "I saw that. Bellemere Mansion. I remember when you said that the property wasn't listed and had just been sitting there for years now."
Alex: "Yeah. Not only that but a lot of people had tried to purchase it, but the original owner had refused to sell."
Kristie: "It's one of the reasons why the news about it sudden sale blew up when it came out. I thought they would keep it under wraps though. Considering how popular it is."ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ ɴovel(ꜰ)ɪre.nᴇt
Kristopher: "That would be close to impossible. Though no one was saying anything, everyone residing in the Platinum Triangle neighbourhoods were paying very close attention to it. If they tried to keep it under wraps, those people have their own special ways of finding out things."
Stacy: "Seems like whoever it is has become a celebrity, even though they might not want it."
Elise: "That's true. But I'm sure that the person will be able to take care of things and handle the attention, and everything that will come. To be able to buy the property from the original owner who was so stubborn and refused to sell, whoever it is must be of high status. Maybe someone from those families."
Alex: "Probably. I actually thought that price would be higher. Considering the whole attention on it, the speculative value was already between $120m+ to $200m+. But for the official amount to be way less than that. I was really shocked."
Harper: "Who knows? It might not be actual amount. Maybe it costs more and they only disclosed this amount for some reason."
Kristie: "I highly doubts it. Disclosing this much would only make people even more curious. Not disclosing it all would had actually been better."
Alex: "But then again, everything was just speculation for those in the real estate market. It was also due to how stubborn the original owner was, that actually made the price to rise so much. Maybe the original price was exactly as disclosed."
Kristie: "Maybe. We will probably find out in the future. I think my dad will dig into it. But he will have to careful not to get himself into trouble."
Alex: "Same with my dad. But he will get the information from the firm's headquarters."
Lana was reading the messages and as she read, she realised how much of a terrifying identity Liam might have. She was finally understanding why her mother's doing her best to gather as much information as she discretely and possibly can on him.
She sighed heavily and decided to send the message to the group. She can't keep it to herself. It's something too heavy and scary. Besides, it would be very wrong of her to do so.
"Guys, Liam is the owner of the Bellemere Mansion. He's the mysterious buyer."
The group chat that was bubbling with messages, suddenly went quiet. It was like someone cast a drought spell on it.
Few seconds later.
Everyone: "No f'ing way!!!"
Stacy: "Lana, are you serious? How did you find out?"
Alex: "Lana! Please! Spill!"
Kristie: "Lana, please tell us what happened!"
Lana smiled and sighed when she saw their reactions. She was expecting and it did feel good seeing how they were begging her to spill what she knew, but her heart felt equally heavy.
She sighed once more and typed the message.
"After he made the payment for the things he bought, he asked for home delivery. I told him that I was already familiar with his address since he lives in the same residential complex as Stacy, but he told me he just moved. I asked for the new address and he told me that he's now staying at Bellemere Mansion in Holmby Hills. I was really shocked to say the least. I lost myself for a moment and asked him again to confirm, and he said the same thing."
Harper: "Holy sh*t!!!"
Kristopher: "Wow!!! Like dayum!!!"
Kristie: "I'm honestly out of words. Like I really have no idea what to say."
Alex: "I'm even more shocked and speechless. My dad's is going to go crazy when he hear this. The kid that came to his office a few days ago with a multimillion dollar property documents was even more scarier than he thought. He will raise Liam's status to VVIP. Man, that's a property in the Platinum Triangle neighbourhoods!!! That's insane!"
Harper: "I will say this for everyone. Who is Liam?!"
Stacy: "I'm the one feeling the most shocked and speechless here. I don't even know how to process everything."
It wasn't just Stacy that was feeling this emotions. Everyone in the group was. And it was even more chaotic for those that have no idea who the mysterious buyer of the property is.
As for the person that caused the chaos? He was enjoying the luxury of his new home.
A/N: I've probably dragged the day for too long. Please continue to support the book with power stones. It helps with visibility on the platform. Your comments are appreciated too. I would love to hear your thoughts. Thanks for reading!

chapters.title: Chapter 25: The Delivery
chapters.content:
Chapter 25 - The Delivery
"Mmmmnhaaah...," Liam yawned loudly as he stretched like a cat on the ultra-comfortable bed.
His arms extended above his head, his back arched just slightly, and the soft sheets rustled under him. The morning sun had already flooded into the room through the tall, automated windows, casting gentle rays across the cream-toned walls and accent pieces. The warmth made the entire scene feel more like a dream than reality.
He yawned again, rolling over and slowly pushing himself into a sitting position on the bed.
His gaze drifted toward the enormous window wall that overlooked the greenery of the vast front lawn. The sun hit the freshly trimmed field just right, highlighting the vibrant hues of the grass and distant topiary edges.
A faint smile appeared on his face.
Even now, everything still felt surreal. But with each passing moment, he was slowly getting used to it. The World-Class Etiquette skill helped. It allowed him to naturally adapt—not just in how he spoke or moved—but in how he processed this new world around him.
He reached out and picked up his phone from the nightstand.
10:22 AM.
"I woke up late... I guess it can't be helped since it was until past midnight before I slept."
He placed the phone back and leaned into the plush headboard, his mind trailing back to the night before.
After finishing the meal delivered to him, he'd spent hours in the private home theater. The recliners were absurdly comfortable—almost more so than his bed. With surround sound perfectly tuned and an IMAX-like screen, the experience had pulled him in like a portal to another dimension.
He watched three movies back-to-back. Before he knew it, it was nearly 2 AM.
A nostalgic grin tugged at the corners of his mouth.
"There's still so much about this mansion I haven't even touched. I'll get to them all soon. For now... I should clean up. The clothes should be arriving soon," he muttered, sliding off the bed and heading for the bathroom.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ N(o)vᴇl(F)ire.nᴇt
Almost half an hour later, Liam stepped out of the bathroom wearing a loose white T-shirt and navy cotton pants. His hair was still slightly damp, and his face was glowing from the warm water and skincare amenities he'd found there.
"What a bathroom experience," he said to himself, shaking his head with a quiet chuckle.
The bathroom at the penthouse apartment had been impressive, but this... this was something else entirely. The sheer size, the amenities, the way the room seemed to respond to his presence with automatic drawers and water settings—everything made him feel like he was living a billionaire's dream.
Not like he wasn't.
He had spent the first ten minutes simply exploring the space, fascinated by it all.
After finishing, he'd stood in the center of his massive walk-in wardrobe—completely empty aside from the custom suit, his shoes, and the watch.
He glanced at the single hanger holding his outfit from the previous day.
"Aren't they here yet?"
As if on cue, the doorbell rang—a soft, melodious chime that echoed through the living room and gently into the rest of the mansion.
Liam's brows raised slightly. "Timing."
He turned and left his room, walking down the hallway toward the dual central stairs. The marble steps were cool under his feet as he made his way down to the expansive living room.
Once there, he approached the front door and tapped the small touchscreen panel mounted beside it. The security camera view popped up instantly, showing the front gate.
There stood Lana.
Liam blinked in faint surprise, but the moment passed quickly. He knew that she was here with the delivery.
He reached out and pressed the silver button beneath the screen. A faint mechanical click sounded outside as the gate smoothly slid open.
Liam opened the front door and waited.
A moment later, the sleek white Mercedes-Benz Sprinter Van, emblazoned with Dior's minimalist logo in black, glided quietly down the driveway. The vehicle was clean, polished, and clearly custom-outfitted for high-end home deliveries. The tires barely made a sound on the paved driveway.
As the van came to a gentle stop near the front steps, the passenger door opened, and Lana stepped out gracefully, followed by a young female assistant whom Liam instantly recognized—the same sales associate who had attended to him in the VIP client room yesterday.
The driver, a tall man in a crisp black uniform, also exited the van and walked around to the rear.
All three of them offered polite bows and greetings.
"Good morning, Mr. Liam," Lana said, keeping her tone professional but warm. "We've brought your items as promised."
Liam nodded with a small smile. "Perfect timing. Thank you."
"If I may ask," she continued, "where would you like us to arrange the items?"
Liam turned slightly and gestured toward the interior. "Yes. Come, I'll show you."
Lana nodded. Before following, she turned to the female sales associate. "Please start bringing the items inside. We'll arrange them in the wardrobe."
"Yes, Miss," the woman responded and moved to open the rear compartment.
Lana followed Liam into the house, and the moment she stepped into the foyer, her steps paused involuntarily.
She wasn't prepared. The grandeur of Bellemere Mansion's interior was unlike anything she'd expected.
The living room opened up like a modern palace—tall ceilings with ambient lighting, an elegant mix of classic and modern interior design, and a quiet harmony that only the most luxurious spaces had.
She composed herself quickly and continued walking behind Liam as he led her through the corridor and up the main staircase. His presence was calm, poised. He walked like someone born into this kind of world, and she found herself admiring his ability to wear everything calmly like a natural extension of himself, without making noise about it.
They entered his bedroom, and Liam casually pointed at the wardrobe.
"This way."
Lana walked in and gave a soft nod of approval. It was large, clean, and empty—just as expected. She turned and offered him a confirming glance.
"I'll bring them up."
With that, she returned to the front door, where the assistant had already started carrying several sleek Dior garment bags and branded storage boxes up the steps.
Together, they transported everything upstairs, careful not to scuff anything or leave a trace behind.
It took them a little over thirty minutes to fully complete the task. Every item was unboxed, unwrapped, and hung or arranged in the wardrobe to perfection.
The shirts were lined by color gradient, the pants folded and stacked with precision, shoes aligned on glass shelves, and belts displayed neatly.
Lana oversaw everything like a practiced stylist. She adjusted hangers, smoothed fabric, and made sure each item was positioned in a way that matched VVIP presentation standards.
After it was done, she turned to Liam and gave a small, graceful bow.
"All your items have been arranged, Mr. Liam. Thank you for trusting us with this delivery."
The assistant echoed her gratitude with a smaller nod.
Liam, who had observed them silently for most of the arrangement, noticed how Lana had kept things completely professional.
She called him by a title throughout and didn't make any unnecessary interaction with him. She didn't ask him anything, neither did she say anything that didn't relate to work.
He smiled. "Thank you both. Everything looks perfect."
They bowed one last time and excused themselves. Liam watched from the window of the living room as the delivery team walked back to the Sprinter, loaded the empty cases, and drove back down the long driveway. The gate closed quietly behind them.
He remained at the window for a moment before letting out a soft yawn and collapsing onto the living room couch.
"I'm starving again..."
He pulled out his phone and opened the app from the restaurant he ordered from last night. And he quickly placed his order.
While waiting for his food, he leaned back and relaxed into the cushions.
Finally, time to do what he hadn't done since he woke up.
"System, sign-in."

chapters.title: Chapter 26: Inviting Stacy And Her Friends
chapters.content:
Chapter 26 - Inviting Stacy And Her Friends
[Ding!]
[Congratulations, Host. You received $1,000,000]ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ NovᴇlFir(e).nᴇt
[You received Rolls-Royce Ghost Black Badge]
[The car's key is in the system's inventory.]
***
Wow! Another cash reward today? And I even got another car. The system is really spoiling me.
Liam had thought that after the massive sign-in rewards of yesterday, today's reward would be reduced or something along the line but he was wrong.
Not only did it not reduce, it actually seen to have become more valuable. A cash reward of $1 million and a luxury car. This was one of the best daily sign-in rewards so far.
Liam picked up his phone and saw that the money had already been deposited. His account balance now sat comfortably above $8 million.
He smiled when he saw his balance. It has been increasing nearly everyday, going from less than $20 to millions in just a week. But the only problem is that he has no idea what to spend the money on... yet.
Let's not think about that. Even though I have no idea now, something will definitely pop up in the near future.
The next moment, he heard a buzzer from the gate intercom system. He stood up from the sofa and walked to the small touchscreen panel beside the front door.
Displayed on the screen was the familiar restaurant-branded car from last night.
Liam opened the front door and walked down the driveway to the gate, to receive the package personally.
When he got to the gate, he saw the same delivery personnel from waiting with a polite and respectful smile on his face.
When he saw Liam, he gave a short, respectful bow and gave him the package, and got back into the car.
Liam collected the package and thanked the man. As the man raised his head and walked back to his car, though it was only for a brief moment, but he could see the shock, curiosity and disbelief in his eyes.
He naturally understood why the man was having such emotions, as he has been getting reactions like that since yesterday.
I wonder when it will stop?
He smiled to himself as he walked back to the mansion.
Inside, he sat down at the dining and enjoyed the delicious meal he had ordered.
"Even more delicious than yesterday, the chef is really good," he moaned in pleasure, as he relished the delicious taste of the food.
As he ate, Liam realised that he would need to employ some workers—maids to help with cleaning the house. They might not do the cooking as he can take care of that, but cleaning such a big house is something he can't do by himself.
But how do I find one? Should I check online? Would probably find one but I don't want just anybody, I need someone trustworthy. It would be best if it's someone recommended by someone I know.
Well that's the problem. Liam doesn't know anone like that. He doesn't even have a y friend. He thought about it and he suddenly remembered Stacy. He also remembered that he promised to take her out for a treat to repay her kindness. There's also her friends too, which he would love to get closer to.
With that thought, he decided to text Stacy and invite her, and her friends to come over to his place.
He texted her and he got a reply immediately.
Stacy: "Hi. Good morning."
Liam: "Good morning. Are you busy? I want to invite you guys over to my place."
Without being told, he could already guess that Lana had told her and others where he's staying now, so there was no need to tell her that he has moved.
After he sent the message, it took a while for Stacy to respond.
"You mean your new place? Bellemere Mansion?" She asked.
"Yes. I want you and everyone to come," Liam replied.
"Ummm... Sure. Sure. Just tell me when and we will be there."
"Today. 4 PM."
"Ok. Thanks. I will inform the others. We will definitely be there. Thank you again for inviting us ☺️☺️"
Liam smiled at her message and dropped his phone back on the dining table, and continued eating his meal.
After he was done eating, he thought of what to do but nothing specific really came to mind. He checked the time and he saw that he it was nearly noon and he decided to just relax and enjoy himself by watching movies in the private home theatre.
As he walked to the theatre, he thought of working out and testing out his strength but he decided against it. He doesn't feel the need to.
Yes, he has been growing stronger lately but since he has surpassed 20 points in all attributes, and still within the range of what other humans can achieve, there was really no need for him to stress himself.
Besides, he had done manual jobs for years, working as construction worker and doing other physically taxing works, before getting the job at the restaurant where he was fired.
Inside the theatre, Liam took his seat on a recliner and picked up the control tablet. He controlled the lighting, dimming it, controlled the curtains, turned on the AC, toggled the TV screen and selected a movie.
The movie started and he controlled the sound system, lowering and increasing the volume to the level he wanted.
He relaxed more comfortably into the recliner and smiled, focusing his attention on the movie playing.
Yeah, this is the life!
***
After the chat with Liam, Stacy immediately texted the group chat and telling them about his invitation.
The group's activity went up immediately and they all wanted to confirm from Stacy if what she said was true. When she confirmed it, they all went quiet for a while before their messages started flooding back in.
They were still talking about Lana's experience when she went to deliver the clothes to his place, and now he's inviting them? They actually couldn't believe it.
They have no idea why Liam was inviting them. Does he actually want to be friends with them or does heneed something from them?
Either way, they were very curious to find out. At least, they know that they don't have to worry about anything bad happening to them as they didn't treat Liam bad that night. In fact, they welcomed him as one of their own, even though he was completely new. And so, their mind was at peace.
But they were feeling very excited to finally grace the popular Bellemere Mansion and possibly become friends with Liam. Though they don't expect the latter to happen immediately, but they are willing to show that they will be valuable to him.

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Grocery Shopping
chapters.content:
Chapter 27 - Grocery Shopping
Later that afternoon.
The second movie had just finished playing. Liam picked up his phone to check the time as he remembered that Stacy and her friends are coming over.
3:16 PM. They should be arriving soon and I haven't even thought of preparing what they will eat.
Since he's inviting them over and they will be his guests, then he will have to treat them. Which mean he has to cook what they will eat but his kitchen is completely empty of ingredients. He would need to go and buy groceries.
Yes, he can order something the food but Liam felt that it wouldn't be appropriate. They are coming to his house, it's only appropriate that they eat home cooked meal. It's completely different if he's taking them out or something.
Besides, he wants to show off his World-Class Culinary Arts skill.
For the groceries, Liam thought of possibly ordering them online and having it delivered to his place, but he decided against it.
He decided to use it as an opportunity to get some fresh air. He has been stuck inside the house for half the day, he really need to stretch his legs a little.
He picked up the control tablet and switched off the TV, the AC and opened the curtain, allowing sunlight to flood the theatre.
After he was done with that, he stood up from the recliner and left the home theatre, before making his way to the garage.
Stepping into the garage, the first thing Liam noticed was the new arrival—the Rolls-Royce Ghost Black Badge—parked there elegantly.
As a sucker for the color black, the car looks stunning.
The deep obsidian black paint absorbed garage's light more than it reflected, giving the car a mysterious, almost void-like presence. Unlike the showy gleam of most luxury cars, this one had a subtle, commanding matte gloss but it made it impossible to ignore.
The Spirit of Ecstasy on the hood wasn't silver—it was gloss black, stealthy and dignified. Even the grille and trim—normally polished chrome—had been darkened to a sleek blackened chrome, keeping the theme consistent and refined.
Its long silhouette looked like it was carved from obsidian, with every curve flowing into the next. The 23-inch carbon alloy wheels were finished in a tinted gloss black, revealing deep red brake calipers that hinted at something fiercer beneath the calm surface.
Even without seeing the interior of the car, Liam already understood why the brand is praised and loved so much by people.
He wanted nothing more at the moment than to take that car out for a spin but he held himself back. He was going to the grocery store, he can't drive a Rolls Royce there... Right?
Yes, he can but he doesn't want to attract any unnecessary attention to himself, so he won't.
The Rolls Royce Ghost Black Badge had now increased the total number of cars he has to five. And he's yet to drive more than half of them.
He smiled as he took out the Maserati GranTurismo key fob from the system inventory and pressed the unlock button.Follow current novels on NovᴇlFɪre.nᴇt
He opened the door, slid into the driver's seat, and started the engine. The car roared to life and he steered it out of the garage, down the long driveway and through the gate.
He drove down the streets of Holmby Hills, making his way to the nearest grocery store being displayed on the car's GPS system.
***
Few minutes later, Liam parked in front of the store and stepped out of the car.
He looked at the store in front of him and shook his head in amusement.
It was just a grocery store—but only in name.
The store sat on a corner plot, its wide single-story structure easily three times the size of a regular supermarket. The exterior was minimalist and modern, designed with light stone, soft wood paneling, and wide vertical windows that stretched nearly from ground to roof. A single matte-gold logo sat above the entrance in small, tasteful lettering: Linden Market.
The clean-cut façade that blended effortlessly with the upscale surroundings.
A uniformed valet at the side entrance nodded at Liam respectfully, even though he hadn't used the valet service.
Liam smiled faintly and walked toward the glass doors.
They slid open smoothly, revealing an interior that felt more like a luxury boutique than a grocery store.
The floor was made of pale travertine marble, polished to a gentle gleam. Soft instrumental music played quietly through discreet ceiling speakers. The scent of fresh-cut flowers and subtle citrus cleaner lingered in the air. Lighting was soft and ambient, seemingly focused more on atmosphere than brightness.
A concierge desk—the counter—sat to the right of the entrance. A well-dressed staff member behind it glanced up, offered a small nod, and returned to assisting a woman dressed in beige designer leisurewear.
Liam's eyes scanned the space.
The aisles were wide—broader than most living rooms—and lined with neatly arranged shelves filled with imported goods, artisanal brands, and organic produce. The layout wasn't cluttered as it looked clean with its intentional design.
He walked past a display of fresh fruit stacked like art—each apple, pear, and pomegranate carefully arranged. To the left was a glass counter for pre-prepped meals, with staff in chef whites serving small, curated dishes like roasted duck salad and truffle pasta.
Most of the customers didn't look rushed and one pushed carts with items piled high. Instead, they carried matte black handbaskets and took their time selecting things like wildflower honey, imported matcha powder, and $40 artisan bread.
Liam couldn't help but smile again.
Even the grocery shopping experience here was part of a curated lifestyle.
He picked up a handbasket and walked into the aisles, casually scanning the shelves. There were no prices on most items. Either you knew, or you didn't care.
He couldn't help but thank the system for the World-Class Etiquette skill, because without it, he would be completely lost and unable to carry himself properly in such a place.
He smiled to himself once more and started picking what he came for as he moved calmly through the aisles, scanning the meticulously arranged sections.
Despite how pristine and curated everything looked, he wasn't the least bit uncomfortable. His posture was relaxed and his pace unhurried. The World-Class Etiquette skill guided his every motion subtly—how he glanced at items, how he picked up and inspected products without fumbling, how he navigated around other shoppers.
The skill was really shaping him up and helping him adapt quickly to the world he was suddenly thrown into.
He started picking the items he needed from the sections. He wants to buy enough grocery to stock his kitchen for a few days and also for what he would cook for Stacy and her friends.
He had already decided on what to cook. The main course would be herb-roasted chicken Thighs with saffron jasmine rice, and the side dish would be heirloom tomato & avocado salad with balsamic glaze. Then ice cream with fruit slices for desert, and for refreshments, chilled citrus-mint mocktails.
Sounds very fancy and probably hard to cook. Fancy, yes. But hard? Not at all. Liam has World-Class Culinary Arts skill, no meal is hard for him to make.
By the time Liam was done with picking the things he needed and made it to the checkout counter, his handbasket was full—but not exaggeratedly so. It was a curated selection, just like everything in the store.
The cashier, a young woman in a pale gray uniform, greeted him politely again.
"Good afternoon, sir. I hope you found everything you were looking for?"
"Yes, thank you," Liam replied, and placed the basket on the counter.
She began scanning the items—each one sliding across the sensor with a soft beep, the price showing briefly on the screen before disappearing.
The total rang up on the discreet side screen: $684.32.
Liam didn't flinch as he pulled out his card and tapped it on the terminal. The beep confirmed the payment had gone through, and the cashier bowed slightly.
"Would you like assistance carrying these to your car?"
"No need. I'm good," Liam replied calmly.
The groceries were placed into three matte-black, reusable shopping bags with the Linden Market logo printed in small gold lettering. They were sturdy and beautifully made—likely worth a lot.
Liam thanked the staff, took the bags, and exited through the glass doors.
Outside, the sun had shifted to the softer tones of late afternoon. His Maserati gleamed under the gentle light, its dark curves reflecting the manicured trees that lined the store's perimeter.
He walked to the car, opened the trunk, and carefully placed the bags inside before climbing into the driver's seat.
The engine purred to life with a low, growl.
As he pulled out of the parking space and steered toward the exit, Liam spared one last glance at the store through the rearview mirror.
"Grocery shopping feels like a fashion show here," he said to himself with a light laugh.
The drive home was quiet and smooth. The streets of Holmby Hills were peaceful, the neighborhood perfectly landscaped and watched over by discreet security patrols.
Every home here was an estate and has a story behind them, giving them their prestige. And the same was so Liam's property.
Soon, the front gates of Bellemere Mansion appeared ahead, and as he approached, they parted for him automatically.
The tires crunched softly over the drive as he pulled into the garage and parked the Maserati beside the Rolls-Royce.
He popped the trunk, grabbed the grocery bags, and walked toward the interior door.
By the time he got to the kitchen, it was 3:40 PM.
"They'll be here in twenty minutes..." he muttered, placing the bags on the counter and moving quickly but gracefully.
He was already running out of time but he felt that he would probably be done before they arrive.
He unpacked the ingredients like a professional chef preparing for a TV show. The kitchen island became his stage, and the ingredients his co-stars.
Time to show them what World-Class Culinary Arts really meant.

chapters.title: Chapter 28: Cooking With Stacy
chapters.content:
Chapter 28 - Cooking With Stacy
Only a few minutes had passed, but everything in the kitchen was progressing smoothly. Even though the dish he's making is something he has never made before, he didn't feel any pressure or make any mistake, as everything has been perfect so far.
Due to the time constraints, he decided to prepare the side dish and the drink first, before the main course. He has less than twenty minutes and Stacy, and her friends would be arriving soon. He wants to make sure that when they arrive, he can offer them something while they wait for the main course.
Since he was only dealing with vegetables and fruits, he was able to finish making it quickly.
And just as he was finishing with them and putting the chicken in the oven, and getting the rice ready to cook, he heard the familiar buzzer of the gate's intercom system.
He turned to the small touchscreen positioned in a corner in the kitchen and he saw Stacy standing at the gate. He walked to it and pressed the gate control button and the gate opened automatically.
He watched as Stacy and her friends drove into the compound, and parked their cars in the visitor's parking space close to the garage, before walking to the front door.
Liam put down the knife he was holding, washed his hands and dried it with a clean towel, and left the kitchen. He walked to the front door and opened it.
Standing at the door were Stacy and her friends. Though Liam didn't remember all of their names, he did remember some, especially Lana, Matt, Kristie and Kristopher.
"Hi guys," he greeted.
"Hi," they all greeted slightly awkwardly.
"Come on in, guys. Don't stand at the entrance," he said as he stepped away from the entrance.
They all nodded at Liam respectfully and walked through the door. When inside, they paused for a moment and took in the view of the mansion's interior.
They had already heard from Lana about how beautiful and amazing the whole place is but words can't do it justice.
Liam smiled when he saw their reaction. Yes, the mansion is pretty amazing. Even he, the owner, is still getting used to it.
"Please make yourself comfortable," he said, gesturing to the sofas in the living room before walking to the kitchen.
They nodded when they heard what Liam and they walked to the living room, but Stacy didn't as she followed behind him.
"Hey," she called out, as she chased after him.
Liam turned back and was surprised to see Stacy following him.
"Hey."
"Ummm... I can smell what you're cooking in the kitchen. I was wondering if I could help out with something. If you don't mind of course," she said with a low voice and a polite, yet slightly nervous smile.
Liam looked at her for a moment, slightly taken aback. He was really surprised as he never expected her to offer to help out.
She just keep proving to me that I saw her in a wrong perspective. Very wrong perspective. Or did she grow up?...
He was quite confused as she wasn't acting anything at all like the Stacy he knew. Or maybe he didn't know her at all.
Actually, now that he thought of it. He never really interacted with her and he never got to know what sort of person she was. The whole image he built about was from what he saw from the distance, what people said and how she carried herself.
Also, it was years ago since he last saw her. A lot of things had probably happened since then and she might had changed thanks to them.
Liam sighed internally and made a decision to discard the previous image he has about Stacy, and start seeing her for who she actually is.
And so, he decided to allow her help out in the kitchen.
"Sure," he nodded.
"Thank you," Stacy smiled, looking really happy.
The both walked to the kitchen and Liam continued what he was doing. But since they are already here, he decided to serve them the side dish.
Stacy's friends watched her following behind Liam and looked at each other in confusion.
"Is she seriously helping him cook?" Matt whispered, wide-eyed.
"I think she is," Kristie murmured softly.
"Wow," Matt smiled in disbelief.
***
Inside the kitchen.
Liam dished the salad and readied the drink, before turning to Stacy who was standing behind him, looking at him with surprise on her face.
"Here. Can you help me serve this," he asked and she nodded.
She picked up the plates and took them to to the dining table, while Liam focused on the rice and chicken for the main course.
After Stacy was done with serving the salad and mocktail, she returned to the kitchen to continue helping him.
"Aren't you going to eat your salad?" Liam asked in surprise, when he saw her standing there, watching him.
He looked at the last plate of salad on the kitchen island and looked at Stacy.
"Ummm. Can I eat it here?" She asked.
"Why not?" Liam smiled.
"Thank you," Stacy said and immediately stuffed a piece of heirloom tomato and avocado into her mouth.
Her eyes closed, as she relished the taste.
"This salad's so good," she muttered, as she stuffed more piece into her mouth.
"Hey. Take it slow. Don't choke yourself," Liam chuckled.
He was really happy that she was genuinely enjoying it as he could see it from her face. Who doesn't love their work being appreciated?
"Truthfully, I would say that this is one of the best salads I've ever had. And I'm not flattering you. I can't wait for the main course," Stacy said, stuffing more of the tomatoe and avocado into her mouth.
"Thank you for the praise," Liam smiled.
"Not at all. You're such a good cook. I can't help but be impressed. You're really just impossible to figure out," she smiled.
Liam chuckled at her words but he didn't say anything.
"Ohhh, least I forget, congratulations on your new place. It's really cool," Stacy said with sincerity.
"Thank you."
"I'm sure you know how popular you are right now," smiled at him.
"Popular? How?" Liam asked, quite surprised and slightly confused.
"Come on. Don't tell me that you don't know about the online articles about the mansion being sold to a mysterious buyer."
"Ohhh, that? I didn't actually pay much attention to them," Liam smiled.
It was just as he said. He never did pay attention to them.
"Of course you didn't. But who would had thought that you were the mysterious buyer. I couldn't contain my reaction when I found out. Actually, I was beyond shocked and speechless.," Stacy said as she thought back to what Lana revealed in the group chat last night.Follow current novels on NovᴇlFɪre.ɴet
"I guess there are a lot of shocking things," Liam smiled and turned to look at her, "Like you for instance."
"Me?" Stacy asked in confusion.
"Yeah. You had no idea but we went to the same middle school and high school together," Liam replied.
"Huh?" Stacy blinked, stunned. "...Wait. What?"
"Maple Hill Middle School, Class 2-B, 9th grade. Hillshire High, Homeroom 10A. Hillshire Spirit Squad. I wasn't noticeable back then. You probably never saw me."
Stacy couldn't believe it. She felt that Liam was probably joking with her. Besides, with his power, digging up information on her was far too easy. She refuse to believe that she went to the same school with him.
Liam saw the disbelief on Stacy's face and he started calling out some names, mentioning some casual and minor things that happened in class, or at school. Something only someone who actually went to school there would know.
"I... You... How?" She asked in utter disbelief.
Liam didn't say anything as he continued what he was doing.
Time passed as Liam got lost in what he was doing. Stacy also helped out silently with disbelief still on her face. It seems like it will take her a while to come to terms with what Liam said.
More than half an hour later, a very rich aroma filled and wafted out from the kitchen, spreading all over the living room and dining.
Food was ready.

chapters.title: Chapter 29: Dinner With Friends...
chapters.content:
Chapter 29 - Dinner With Friends...
"Wow! This smells delicious," Kristie said with a bright smile on her face, her eyes lighting up as she stared at the dishes in front of her.Follow current ɴᴏᴠᴇʟs on No(ᴠ)ᴇlFire.nᴇt
Everyone else was already seated around the large dining table, eyes wide and focused on the perfectly arranged plates.
The vibrant golden rice gave off a light saffron aroma, the herb-roasted chicken thighs were perfectly crisp with a glistening glaze.
Liam placed the last of the dishes on the table and took his seat with a soft, welcoming smile. "Thank you all for coming. I really appreciate you being here today."
"You're the one thanking us?" Matt chuckled. "Liam, you invited us into Bellemere Mansion, cooked for us, and treated us like royalty. If anything, we should be thanking you."
"Seriously," Harper added with a light laugh. "I don't think any of us have ever been hosted like this by someone our age. You've set the bar a little too high."
"Thank you for inviting us," Kristopher said, raising his glass. "To Liam."
"To Liam," everyone echoed, clinking their mocktails together gently.
With the pleasantries out of the way, the group turned their attention to the food.
One by one, they picked up their utensils and took the first bite. And one by one, their expressions shifted.
Lana blinked in disbelief. Matt's eyes widened. Elise let out a small gasp. Even Alex paused mid-chew, visibly stunned.
"This is... incredible," Kristie said slowly, as though trying to confirm that her tongue wasn't playing tricks on her.
"Okay, I was ready to give you compliments either way," Harper said, shaking her head with a smile. "But this is not me flattering you. This food tastes exceptional."
They all went back in for another bite. Then another. And soon, the table grew quiet—not out of awkwardness, but from mutual reverence for what they were tasting.
"This chicken is better than anything I've had at my dad's private dinner parties," Kristopher said. "And he literally hires celebrity chefs."
"The rice..." Kristie muttered, "how is it this fluffy and fragrant?"
Matt gave a muffled groan. "Bro, I'd pay to eat this again. Like, seriously."
As they ate, their eyes kept darting to Liam, curiosity bubbling behind every glance. They wanted to ask—how did he learn to cook like this? Where did he train? How was it possible that someone their age could create dishes better than half the professionals they'd encountered in their lives?
But none of them asked.
It wasn't just the taste. It was the way the food was plated, the portions, the texture, the contrast of flavors—it all spoke of someone with not just talent, but mastery. And that... was hard to question without sounding intrusive.
So, they simply enjoyed it.
After everyone was done, they sat back, sipping the last of their mocktails with satisfied expressions and full bellies.
"Liam, this was honestly perfect," Stacy said softly, smiling at him from across the table.
"Yeah, man. You seriously outdid yourself," Alex added, giving him a thumbs-up.
Liam nodded appreciatively. "Thanks. I'm glad you all enjoyed it. I also got a little help from Stacy."
They all laughed when they heard this.
"Nahh. I didn't do much except stand around in the kitchen and cause distraction," Stacy laughed.
As the others started rising from the table and heading toward the living room to relax, Liam remained behind, quietly gathering up the plates and cutlery.
To his surprise, Stacy stayed behind as well.
"I'll help," she said, already reaching for a stack of dishes.
"You don't have to," Liam said.
"I know," she replied, giving him a grin. "But let me. Please."
"Sure," Liam nodded.
Together, they cleared the table, their movements synchronized and casual. Liam carried most of the heavier dishes while Stacy grabbed the glasses and lighter items.
Once inside the kitchen, Stacy washed while Liam dried and put things away.
Liam glanced sideways at Stacy and noticed that the disbelief from earlier had faded. Her face had relaxed into her usual calm expression.
He smiled and continued what he was doing. Though she was calm on the surface, he knew that something has changed and she was still trying to wrap her head around what he told her.
She will probably investigate to confirm.
After the dishes were done, they both dried their hands and walked back into the living room together.
The rest of the group was lounging comfortably. Some on the long sectional couch, others on the armchairs, chatting softly and enjoying the relaxed atmosphere.
Liam sat down, and everyone turned to him expectantly.
"So... what do you guys want to do now?" he asked.
Everyone looked at each other.
"Honestly, we didn't have anything planned," Lana admitted. "We just came to chill and see the place."
"Yeah," Matt agreed. "We're just vibing with whatever the host has planned."
Liam nodded. "Alright. Then let's just talk."
They spent the next thirty minutes conversing about random things—recent gossip, funny moments from the group chat, and random topics. Eventually, the conversation circled back to Bellemere Mansion.
"So," Harper said, raising a brow, "are we allowed to ask how you managed to buy this place?"
Liam smiled calmly. "I've been fortunate. That's all I'll say."
There were a few amused glances and nods. Everyone could tell he wasn't going to spill details, and they respected that.
There's three things that intrigue and scares the elite—things they don't know, things they don't understand and things they can't control.
And Liam was all three. Everyone here knew that and it's the same reason why they want to be on his good side.
It's been a full day since Liam bought the mansion and moved. Some people had probably already dug up his background, but they didn't find what they were looking for.
And what was that? His actual identity. Sure, they may found out about his actual parents and how they technically made him an orphan young, but there was no way that they would believe such two normal, ordinary people gave birth to someone who can easily spend tens of millions of dollars. It was something impossible to believe.
"You're like a mystery box," Alex muttered.
Kristie laughed. "A rich mystery box."
Eventually, Stacy leaned forward slightly. "Hey, Liam. You wanna join our group chat?"
Everyone looked up.
"Yeah!" Kristie said immediately. "You should totally join."
"It's mostly memes and nonsense, but we keep each other in the loop," Matt added.
Liam smiled. "Sure, why not?"
Stacy pulled out her phone and tapped away quickly. Moments later, Liam's phone buzzed with the invite. He accepted.
"Welcome to Chaos Corner," Alex said grandly, and everyone laughed.
"If you ever need anything, any assistance, you can chat us up, we will help out if we can," Kristopher said and they echoes their agreement would nods.
"Thank you. I will hold back," Liam smiled.
They talked for a little longer, but by now, the sky outside was already beginning to darken. The rich orange glow of sunset filtered through the tall windows.
"I think we should head out," Matt said, standing.
"Yeah, it's getting late," Elise added. "Driving around here too late might not be the best idea."
One by one, they stood and began thanking Liam again for his hospitality.
He walked them to the front door and held it open as they stepped out into the cool evening air.
"Thanks again, Liam. For everything," Kristopher said with a wave.
"See you in the chat," Matt grinned.
Each of them made their way to their cars and started pulling out of the driveway, but Stacy lingered at front door for a moment longer.
She stood at the threshold, looking at him.
"Thank you," she said quietly.
Liam met her gaze. "You're welcome."
She smiled faintly, then looked away and stepped toward her car.
Liam watched her drive off with the others, the gate closing softly behind them. He exhaled a long breath and stepped back into the quiet of the mansion.

chapters.title: Chapter 30: Surprising Daily Sign-in Rewards
chapters.content:
Chapter 30 - Surprising Daily Sign-in Rewards
With everyone gone, Liam could finally get some rest and relax. He enjoyed the time he spent with Stacy and her friends, and he doesn't regret inviting them over.
They once again proved to him that they are good people and they are worth being friends with.
Naturally, he noticed the curiosity they had towards him but he also loved the fact that they didn't pry. When they saw that he wasn't giving them any answer, they steered the conversation to something casual.
As for Stacy, Liam has no idea how his relationship with her would be going forward because of him revealing to her that he went to the same school and was in the same class as her, but he felt that it won't change much.
He was sure that she would investigate to confirm if what he said was true. But Liam doesn't mind. Nothing changed after she confirms it. It might change her attitude towards him. Probably. But that's of little concern to him.
It's not like he likes her or anything. Besides wanting to be friends with her, he doesn't want anything else from her.
Then there's question of how he as someone who came from a modest background was able to attend the same school as Stacy.
Well, the reason was because his mom was working as a househelp for one particularly rich family.
Funny enough, the man his mother married was the eldest son of her employer.
Actually, thinking back to it, Liam remembered something and he couldn't help but find his mother's action of marrying that person quite suspicious.
If he remembered correctly, two weeks before his dad left, the person would always come to drop off his mom in his car. But he would park at the entrance and a few minutes would pass before his mom step out with a smile.
Was she...? No, she didn't... But that could be the only explanation for everything.
Liam sighed as he pushed the thoughts out from his mind. The past was the past. Dwelling on it won't change anything.
The night is still young. Might as well do something to pass the time. Should I continue the series I was watching or play some games?
He thought about it and finally decided on gaming for the night.
***
Meanwhile, as Stacy and her friends were arriving home, they were immediately bombarded with questions by parents and family members.
Their questions were naturally about Liam, what they were about to find out from him, what sort of person he is and a couple of other things.
The kids were overwhelmed at first but they quickly adjusted and smiled, as they tool their seats and started telling their parents what they knew about Liam.
Naturally, there was nothing much to say. Their parents had already investigated Liam's background and found nothing relates to his "actual" identity. All they found was that he was the child of two ordinary people who abandoned him at quite an early age and since then, he had to start working for himself.
But how could they simply believe that those two ordinary people are Liam's actual parents and his background was so simple? If so, then how was he able to buy such a property from the original owner?
It was impossible for him to be into something illegal as flags would had already been raised when he bought the house. But nothing has happened so far and it doesn't look like it would happen in the future.
And so, they didn't believe it literally but instead, interpreted it to fit their own narrative—what they wanted to believe. The only explanation that was more believable to them.
What they interpreted Liam's identity and background to was that he was from a very powerful family. The two individuals called his parents are actually staffs from that family tasked to watch over him while he grew up.
They didn't abandon him but actually left him to grow up and temper himself by experiencing the world. And when the higher ups in the family felt that he had qualified, he started by giving him a little bit of money, the car and the penthouse. Then everything else followed and now it's the mansion.
To them, this was the only plausible explanation. It made far more sense than him being a nobody. Far better sense.
This was only for those who knew that Liam is the mysterious buyer of the property. As for those that has no idea, he would still keep being that mysterious buyer.
***
The next morning, Liam woke up feeling quite refreshed. With the usual, bright morning smile on his face, he got into a sitting position on the bed and did his daily ritual.
"System sign-in."
[Congratulations, Host. You received $15 million.]
[You received 0.02 of JP Morgan shares.]
Huh?
Liam was little taken aback by the reward. Even though the World-Class Etiquette skill was helping him, he couldn't control his emotions when he saw how he received in cash reward.
A whopping $15m!!!
Just this alone was enough to widen his smile and make it brighter, and increase the glow of his face.
"$15m??? This..." Liam was short for words.
His phone buzzed and he saw the credit alert of the amount being deposited into his account, increasing his balance to a staggering $23m!
"Wow!" He muttered in shock.
He took a deep breath and exhaled slowly, trying to calm down his emotions. He succeeded and he turned his attention to the second reward.
"0.02% of JP Morgan? Is that a lot or too much?" He asked with an incredulous look.
He immediately went on the internet to check the current stock price of JP Morgan and its market cap.
"Stock price is $289 and its market cap is $801b."
Using the data he got, he did his calculations and he found out how much his 0.02% shares is worth.
$160m!!!
"Wait a minute. Is this for real?" He asked himself, as he did the calculation again to confirm but he still got the same result.
Wanting to confirm for the final time, he inputed the data into a AI chatbot but he got the same result.
$160m...
This was a huge amount even for Liam. As far as he remember, the most valuable asset he has is the mansion with its value of more than $70m.Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs
But he now has something with more than double its value.
"The system really wasn't joking by its name and when it said that it intends to make me the wealthiest person in the world," Liam smiled to himself.
He really didn't expect to receive such a reward during his daily sign-in. Now, be couldn't help but be curious about his second weekly sign-in rewards and his first monthly sign-in rewards.
"Life's good," Liam smiled from ear to ear.
With the shares, he now has another source of passive income.
He was still thinking of the amount he would receive in the future as dividend, when his phone started ringing. He took a look at it and he saw that it was an unknown number.
Strange... Who could it be? Is it one of Stacy's friends?
He hasn't saved their contacts so he has no idea if they were the one. He thought about who could be calling but when he couldn't guess who it was, he picked up the call.
