chapters.title: Chapter 53: Social Media Ghost King
chapters.content:
Chapter 53: Social Media Ghost King
Time passed and the day went by for Liam, as he spent it at home. He watched movies, played games and chatted with Stacy, and the others.
The chat had become the day’s true entertainment.
Stacy, Lana, Kristie, and Elise were at the center of it, laughing as they shared screenshots of their Instagram stories blowing up.
The yacht photos and short clips — candid laughter by the pool, panoramic shots of the Mia cutting through the open water, close-ups of their faces against a sunlit backdrop — had spread across their feeds like wildfire.
And the comments? Predictable, yet endlessly amusing.
Envy. Jealousy. Curiosity.
People wanted to know who they were with, how they got access to such a yacht, whether the guy behind it was some heir, some prince, some ghost of a dynasty no one had heard of.
"Honestly, the DMs are insane right now," Lana typed, followed by a crying-laughing emoji.
Elise replied seconds later: "Mine too. Some girl literally asked if I’d joined a secret society 💀."
The boys found it hilarious, chiming in between their own jokes, but it was the girls who carried most of the conversation.
Stacy sent another screenshot — a comment section blowing up with speculation.
Liam read it all with smiles on his face. He didn’t mind the noise. If anything, it was amusing to watch how quickly people could spin themselves into knots over a few photos.
But then, mid-scroll, the conversation shifted.
"Liam," Kristie wrote suddenly, "what’s your Insta handle? We can tag you in the posts."
Liam paused. His thumbs hovered above the screen for a moment before he typed back: "Don’t have one."
The group went silent for a beat. Then the replies poured in.
"WHAT?"
"No way."
"You’re lying."
But he wasn’t.
When they pressed him, he told them the truth. How he never got around to creating one.
The reason wasn’t because he didn’t want to but because life hadn’t allowed him the luxury.
After his parents abandoned him, his days had been consumed with surviving, with working shifts until his body ached, with overthinking bills, debts, and the suffocating uncertainty of the next day. There had been no space for social media in that life. There was no time for late-night scrolling or mindless posting.
If anything, he admitted to himself, he thought that might have been one of the reasons why his past had felt so miserable. Humans needed outlets — ways to laugh, to share, to distract themselves from the crushing indifference of the world. Without that, life had been nothing but work and worry.
The girls naturally did what they do best as they immediately forced him into creating an account.
It took less than ten minutes. He picked a clean username, uploaded no profile picture, and followed no one. But the moment he sent the handle into the group, the flood began.
One by one, Stacy, Lana, Kristie, Elise, and the boys followed him. And because their pages had thousands — in some cases hundreds of thousands — of followers, the ripple effect was immediate.
By the evening, Liam’s brand-new account had crossed 100,000 followers.
Curious strangers flooded in, desperate to know who this account belonged to. Why were these popular girls following him? Why did he have no posts, no bio, no hint of identity?
Speculation spread like fire. People began digging, trying to connect dots, but they found nothing. Liam Scott didn’t exist on the internet. At least, not in a way that could satisfy them.
And while the world spun itself into curiosity, Liam set the phone aside and leaned back on the sofa, chuckling under his breath. He had no intention of posting and he had nothing to post.
***
Though the day was uneventful, it wasn’t wasted.
In the afternoon, he had called Daniel Conley.
Daniel’s voice was calm, professional as always, but Liam could sense the man’s genuine interest as he explained some of his plan for the company and how he wanted the company structured under the trust for protection.
He only told him the things he wanted him to know. There was no need telling him about the type of techs he has planned or the molecular assembler. But he did tell him that the company will be a tech company.
Daniel had listened without interruption, and when Liam finished, he offered quiet but firm approval.
"You’re thinking the right way, Liam. I can sense that you already have something incredible planned and if you’re to release it, acquisition attempts will be inevitable. And not polite ones. But if we build this correctly, not even the biggest corporations will be able to swallow you up."
The assurance had lifted a weight from Liam’s chest. He thanked Daniel, and Daniel promised to be ready the moment Liam decided to make his move.
Liam asked him when the trust will be ready and Daniel told him it will take nearly a week more.
Liam hung up the phone and a new thought began to gnaw at him.
Money.
The assembler cost $100 million. He had $27 million in liquid assets, which left him short by $73 million. The gap was large, but not insurmountable and he trusted the system to close it sooner rather than later.
The real issue was where to put the thing once he had it.
He couldn’t set it up in Bellemere Mansion. That was obvious.
The assembler wasn’t a toy. It was advanced, delicate and it requires staggering amounts of energy. Enough to make the local utility companies raise their eyebrows and start asking questions.
He couldn’t afford those questions. Which meant he needed a site.
Not just any site, either. He needed something discreet, private, large enough to house not only the assembler but also the infrastructure around it — logistics, security, maybe even a cover front.
He leaned back in his sofa, tapping his fingers lightly against the armrest.ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ
Industrial sites in Los Angeles were limited, and the ones worth owning weren’t exactly invisible. If he bought a factory outright, people would notice. But if he went too small, it would look suspicious when a supposedly "empty" building started pulling enough electricity to power a stadium.
And then there was zoning, inspections, compliance — layers of bureaucracy that would slow him down.
Unless...
Unless he went through the trust.
Daniel could set up shell companies, cover entities that purchased the site in layers deep enough that even the IRS would lose its way tracing them. If he positioned the factory under a subsidiary that looked like it belonged to an unremarkable logistics firm, no one would question it.
But that raised another question: should he build in Los Angeles at all?
He thought about it.
L.A. had advantages — proximity, access to ports, connections. But it also had drawbacks: too many eyes, too much noise, too many people sniffing around.
A remote location might be safer. Nevada, perhaps. Or somewhere along the California desert where land was cheap, power was abundant, and prying eyes were fewer.
He rubbed his chin, staring at the ceiling as ideas tumbled.
For the first time since acquiring the system, Liam felt the full weight of scaling. Owning supercars and yachts was one thing. But creating technology that would shake the entire world? That demanded foundations.
And foundations required patience.
***
The evening sun bled slowly across the sky, casting long golden shafts into the mansion’s living room. Liam stood by the window, hands in his pockets, eyes distant.
On the phone, Stacy’s messages pinged again. She was laughing at the chaos on Instagram, joking about how his silence was making people crazy and calling him the ghost king of Instagram.
He smiled and put his phone back in his pocket. Their curiosity was the least of hi problem at the moment. He has more important things to worry about.
The next moment, he heard Evelyn’s voice, bringing him out of his thoughts.
"Sir, dinner’s ready."
Liam nodded and went to the dining table for dinner. After he was done, he went up to his room, retiring for the night.
The day has been long and fulfilling, and he was grateful to the people that made it fun for him.

chapters.title: Chapter 54: Second Weekly Sign-in
chapters.content:
Chapter 54: Second Weekly Sign-in
The next morning.
This was the day! The big day! The day of the second weekly sign-in!
Liam was very excited. It was the same reason he woke up with a bright smile on his face.
He looked out the window with his mind filled with thoughts on today’s possible rewards.
Would I get another property? More attribute points? How much in cash?
These questions and more swirled around in his head but he knew that the only way to find out was to sign-in.
But he didn’t do that. He doesn’t want to sign-in yet as he wants to take his bath first and changing into a new set of clothes.
Immediately, he swung his legs down from the bed and walked to the bathroom. He took his time inside, allowing the water to run down every inch of his body.
What was Liam doing exactly? Well, he trying to increase his luck. Call him stupid, superstitious, or whatever, he doesn’t mind.
The truth is that he just wants to follow the same pattern as last week. Maybe that way, he might increase his chances for receiving rewards even crazier than his first weekly sign-in.
Some minutes later, Liam walked out of the bathroom and walked into the walk-in wardrobe. He put on a new set of clothes and walked back to the room.
He let out a lengthy sigh and with a smile, he sat down on the bed.
Let’s do this.
System, sign-in.
[Ding!]
[Congratulations, Host, on your second weekly sign-in.]
[You received $50,000,000]
[You received 1% shares of JP Morgan]
[You received 0.5% shares of
[You received a McLaren P1 LM-X]
[You received+20 Attribute Points]
[Note: The car is parked in the garage and its key is in the inventory]
***
Wow...
Liam was left speechless for a moment when he saw the rewards, but the alert notification of his phone quickly brought him out of his reverie.
These rewards are... They are... Amazing!!!
Just the $50m was enough to make anyone understand just how crazy this weekly rewards are.
He remembered that the amount he received in cash reward from his first weekly sign-in was $5m. And he got 10x that today!
Yes, he had received cash rewards higher than $5m during the week, but the highest he ever received was $15m and the total amount he received during the week was $31m.
Liam picked up his phone and tapped on the notification, and he saw his account balance.
"$77m..."Liam muttered slowly.
It was a crazy amount. It was enough to buy another Bellemere Mansion or a mansion in the Platinum Triangle. It was an amount that goes beyond life changing.
Fuuu...
Liam sighed slowly, gathering his thoughts and emotions.
He smiled from ear to ear as he took another look at the amount now sitting in his account, before turning his attention to the other rewards.
1% shares of JP Morgan... Was this what the system was aiming at from the beginning,
Liam thought to himself.
Over the week, he had consecutively received 0.2% shares of JP Morgan for six days straight, accumulating to a total of 0.12% shares and valued at $1.6b.
Now, plus this 1% shares which is valued at $16b, his shares has been brought up to 1.12% and with a total value of $17.6b!
Wow... This is... I don’t even know what to say...
If $77m wasn’t an amount that can taken casually. Then what about an asset with a value of $17.6b? It was an astronomical amount.ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ
It was an amount that was enough to put him comfortably in the top 120 of the documented world’s richest people list.
Liam felt a huge wave of gratitude towards the system. The value of the rewards wasn’t just in his monetary value but also in the leverage it would give him. It would help him to easier navigate his way when he starts launching his products.
He let out a deep breath as he looked at the third reward. 0.5% shares of the third most valuable company in the world.
And as for the value of that amount of shares? $17.2b. Even without anything said, one can understand just how valuable it is.
The company is one of the most profitable companies in the world and one of the few companies with their market capitalisation going into trillions of dollars. And just 0.5% shares of it was already with so much.
$17.6b plus $17.2b. That’s $34.8b... Wow... Just wow...The rewards really just keeps getting better.
$34.8b. Liam was still trying to find the appropriate words, phrase or sentence he can use to describe how he was feeling at the moment.
To compare, the amount would easily earn him a place in the top 60 documented world’s richest people. That was a 50% jump from his previous position of 120, and a 97.7% leap upward from the bottom of the list.
It’s even crazier that all these has happened in just a week.
Liam closed his eyes briefly and exhaled deeply. He had been really looking forward to today’s rewards and not only was it even better than the previous, it was mind blowing.
$50m in cash and $33.2b in asset. What monstrous reward.
He didn’t receive any property today but they was even more valuable than any property he could possibly receive.
There were still more rewards to check out.
"McLaren P1 LM-X... Never heard of it. Is it a car that was custom ordered by the system?" Liam muttered to himself.
He picked up his phone and searched for the car’s name on the internet. Immediately, his screen was flooded with information.
Immediately, information about the car started was transferred by the system and his eyes widened in a mix of shock and disbelief.
According to the information from the system, the McLaren P1 LM is super exclusive limited edition car. It’s essentially a road-legal upgrade of the McLaren P1 GTR and only five of it were made.
Also, just as you can already guess, all five units were sold out. And each of them cost between $3m to $5m.
Then what about the McLaren P1 LM-X he received? Yes, it was custom ordered by the system, which means that it’s a one-off commission and Liam’s version is the only one in the world.
As for the details about the car? Well, it’s an even crazier version of the original P1 LM. This explains why the X in the name stands for Extreme. Another reason for that is because it’s the combination between a track car and road worthy car.
But appearance wise, it looks no different from the original McLaren P1 LM but it comes with enhanced aerodynamics with retractable rear wing and custom diffuser, a tuned hybrid system that gives it a crazy 1,150hp and a top speed of 255mph. And for weight reduction, it’s interior is extensively covered with carbon fibre.
Then for the paintwork, it comes with a mix of liquid platinum white and black diamond. The seats are made of premium quality leather and with golden eagle embossed in it. And it also has hold plated heat shield.
As for the cost of everything? $7m!
Isn’t that a bit cheap? Well, the system knows how to get a bargain.
Liam was very curious to see the new car and he was itching to take it out for a ride, and see what sort of monster the system got him.
He immediately got up from the bed and left his room. There’s one more reward; the 20 attribute points but he didn’t bother with it as he has no intention of allocating it yet.
For now, he will eat first, then he will unleash the beast in his garage.

chapters.title: Chapter 55: Causing Waves
chapters.content:
Chapter 55: Causing Waves
Liam was currently in the dining, enjoying the lovely breakfast that the maids prepared for him.
But he had no idea that while he ate, his name was causing a bit of a ruckus in two of the biggest companies in the world.
***
The 48th floor of 383 Madison Avenue, home to JPMorgan’s Investor Relations team.
It’s usually a controlled space as spreadsheets, earnings reports, and analyst calls dictated the rhythm here. Nothing much surprised them anymore. Especially not when they handled some of the largest institutional investors on the planet.
But this morning was different.
A very familiar name had popped up on their tracking systems. It was a name that has been popping up consecutively since the beginning of the week. And each time, it popped up, it was always with the same about of shares—0.02%.
It has happened so many times that they have stopped paying attention to it but they can’t do that today.
And this was because the name didn’t pop up with the usual percentage of shares but an even more staggering percentage.
1%
When they sae that the system had flagged a shareholder crossing a critical ownership threshold. They thought that it was of the usual suspects — BlackRock, Vanguard, Fidelity, or State Street. Or a sovereign wealth fund.
But it wasn’t one of those names. It was the same name that they all have come to become familiar with during the week.
Liam Scott.
Before today, he previously held 0.12% of the company, but with the new purchase, he now holds 1.12%.
In raw numbers, that represented nearly $17.6 billion worth of shares. This was enough to put him among the bank’s largest individual shareholders worldwide. And also enough to make the boardroom take notice of him.
"Who is this guy really?" one analyst muttered, leaning over his colleague’s screen.
"Just... an individual," the colleague replied, scrolling through the Bloomberg terminal.
That was the unsettling part.
Marianne Duval adjusted her glasses and sat straighter at her desk. She remembered the first day his name popped up and she was told to attend to him.
Then, who had thought that this random name was actually a hidden monster, going from 0.02% to 1.12% in just a week.
She was really finding it hard to believe that this name belongs to an individual and not a institution.
But the name’s actual identity is none of her business. All she needs to do was her job and that was what she’s doing as her fingers moving quickly across the keyboard, updating Liam’s file on her computer.
Next to Liam’s name, she added a bright red tag:
VIP PRIORITY — ULTRA HIGH NET WORTH SHAREHOLDER.
This wasn’t something to handle casually. A shareholder of that size would expect—
Not expect but demand direct access, clear communication, and tailored service. And it wasn’t something she can handle.
She immediately flagged the record for escalation and forwarded it up the chain. From her seniors, it would rise to the director. From there, perhaps higher still.
After she did that, she sat back, staring at the name on her screen.
Liam Scott... Who exactly are you?
***
Applē Park, Cupertino, California
On the other side of the country, the reaction was equally the same.
The company’s Investor Relations team operated from within the ring-shaped campus at Cupertino — a temple of glass and steel.
They were used to fielding calls from the largest funds in the world, managing trillion-dollar market optics with poise.
But when the system flagged a shareholder crossing the 0.5% threshold — a $17.2 billion stake — even the most seasoned officers felt their composure wobble.
Half a percent of the company wasn’t a casual number. Even Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway, their most famous shareholder, loomed large over the company. The arrival of a new name, outside of the usual institutional channels, demanded immediate scrutiny.
A small group gathered in the glass-walled conference room overlooking the inner park. In front of them, screens glowed with spreadsheets and registry data.
"Liam Scott," one officer said flatly, the name still unfamiliar in her mouth. "There has been no prior filings for this name before. His name doesn’t tie him to any family office or affiliated fund."
Another frowned. "Could be a proxy. Someone shielding a larger interest."
"Or," the first replied, "it’s exactly what it looks like. An individual. Which makes it more complicated."
The company didn’t like surprises. Every shareholder above a certain threshold was mapped, tracked, and quietly profiled. The fact that someone could appear with half a percent stake and with no footprint was more than surprising. It was borderline unnerving.
They quickly escalated the file. Within the hour, Applē’s CFO had been briefed and his instructions were firm:
"Reach out quietly and offer courtesy engagement. We need to know who we’re dealing with."
***
Both companies’ teama got to work and by mid-morning, they had updated their top investor lists. And in both, the name Liam Scott now sat prominently near the top, highlighted in bold.
Both companies began doing what they did best: mobilizing resources.
The compliance team checked regulatory filings, ensuring that Liam’s stake had been properly recorded with the SEC.
Corporate Security team ran background checks — discreetly, of course. Nothing invasive enough to spark headlines, but thorough enough to confirm he wasn’t tied to a hostile entity.Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs NovᴇlFirenᴇt
And most importantly, Applē’s vestor Relations prepared their outreach. Including JP Morgan.
***
Meanwhile, Liam was just finishing his meal. He placed the cutlery in its appropriate position and stood up.
"The meal was delicious as always, Evelyn," he said, as he left the dining.
"Thank you, sir. I will pass your compliment to the girls," Evelyn said, with a low bow.
Liam walked to the garage’s interior door and opened it. He stepped into the garage and the lights lot up simultaneously, flooding the space.
Immediately, what caught Liam’s attention was the new car. The McLaren P1 LM-X.
The car’s looked like an absolute beast under the garage’s light. The paintwork shifted like liquid metal, a seamless blend of platinum white and black diamond flecks that glittered like starlight whenever the light struck at an angle. The surface shimmered, as if it were alive, bending the glow into a spectrum of icy silvers and midnight shadows.
Wow!
It looked even more beautiful in person than the image in his head.
Liam waved his had, retrieving its key fob from the inventory as he walked towards it. He pressed the unlock button and it made the familiar beep sound.
He opened the door and slowly slid into the extremely comfortable driver’s seat. He stared at the peculiar wheel and grabbed with it with a smile, having a feel of it in his hand.
He slowly reached for the ignition button and pressed it, and immediately, the car roared to life in the garage.
The sound of the engine was melodious to Liam’s ear.
How could it not? This is a $7m engine singing. The sound is definitely Grammy awards worthy.
With a bright smile on his face, Liam slowly steered the car towards the exit ofthe garage.
The door opened up automatically and he drove up the sloppy entrance of the garage, and down the long driveway, to the gate.
It also opened automatically and Liam drove out onto the wider roads of Holmby Hills. He didn’t step on the gas as he wants to enjoy a leisure ride first before truly unleashing the beast.

chapters.title: Chapter 56: A Thrilling Experience
chapters.content:
Chapter 56: A Thrilling Experience
Liam slowly drove out of Holmby Hills and he guided the car up the sloped driveway and onto Sunset Boulevard, the streets lined with palm trees and multi-million-dollar homes.
It has been a few minutes since he took the car out and he has really been enjoying the drive so far.
Though he hasn’t pushed the car due to the fact that he’s driving on residential street, he can already see the car living up to the concept behind it. Ultimate speed.
The car has a top speed of 255mph and it’s currently cruising at less than half of quarter of the its top speed.
As for where he will push the car to its limit, he already has an idea and was currently on his way there now.
He slowly drove down Sunset Boulevard with a smile on his face. He made sure he enjoyed the view as coming out for him is something that can be considered rare.
Liam was casually enjoying the drive and he had no idea that the car was already turning heads, and attracting attention.
In the world of cars, there are people called car spotters. They are basically considered the watchdog of car culture.
In other words, they are enthusiasts who dedicate their time to finding, photographing, and filming rare, exotic, or unusual cars on public roads. Some are just purely enthusiasts, while some are semi-pro or community driven.
You can find them hanging around high-end areas like Beverly Hills, Sunset Boulevard, Rodeo Drive, Holmby Hills, London’s Knightsbridge, Monaco, Dubai’s Marina, Tokyo’s Roppongi.
And in L.A, there are tons of car spotters who hang around places like Rodeo Drive, Sunset Boulevard, and Malibu Country Mart, filming every rare hypercar.
And that was the reason why the moment the McLaren P1 LM-X was spotted, their phones and cameras started clicking.
As people very familiar with all sorts of hyper cars, they were very familiar with the McLaren P1 LM and this car shares very uncanny similarities to it, except the paintwork and the near-absense of a rear wing.
"Is that a McLaren P1 LM?" One of the asked, as his camera made a clicking sound, taking a picture of the car.
"It looks familiar but it’s not it. No rear wing and the paintwork is unique. See how it shimmers under the sunlight?" The spotter beside replied, staring at his tab and watching the video footage being fed to it by the drone following behind the car.
"Then it’s probably a secret MSO (McLaren Special Project), an unreleased car or the prototype for a never-released track car. Or it’s a variant," the first spotter said.
The second spotter nodded in agreement and added, "Either way, we can leave it to the forums and outlets like Supercar Blondie, Top Gear, Car Throttle and Robb Report to get the necessary information from McLaren."
"Can you guess who’s driving it?" The first spotter asked, smiling, as he took more pictures of the car.
"Easy. Probably a billionaire, a celebrity or a Saudi prince. It has to be anyone between them."
Meanwhile, Liam had already noticed that he was starting to attract some attention. If he had no idea before, then the group of boys and girlsrunning slowly following behind him, with their phones out, was enough to make him aware.
But he wasn’t worried because the glasses of the car are all tinted and no one can see the person behind the wheel.
Liam was okay with showing off the car but becoming a celebrity, having paparazzis chase after him and his life being put under scrutiny by people who has no idea what he might be going through, wasn’t something he wants.
Of course, Liam was probably overthinking this but he won’t be taking any chances. And that was why he immediately stepped on the gas a little, as he turned toward Rodeo Drive, the car gliding into the palm-lined street.
Immediately, he felt all eyes on him but he didn’t pay attention to them, as he kept his pace slow, letting the car’s low rumble echo off the boutique façades. He could feel the weight of eyes on him from every angle.
He exited Rodeo and turned back toward Sunset Boulevard. Guiding the car east, Liam let Sunset Boulevard carry him through Hollywood, weaving through the slow-moving traffic with ease.
At an open stretch, he flicked his wrist, and the car surged forward effortlessly, the power under his command but never unruly.
By the time he merged onto the freeway and veered north toward Glendale, the horizon opened into brighter morning sky and rising silhouettes of the San Gabriel Mountains.
And then, at last, he reached Angeles Crest Highway.
Liam slowed to a crawl at the first turnout, the car idling like a beast straining against a leash. He toggled a switch on the dash.
With a soft mechanical whine, the rear wing deployed, rising from the tail like a blade being drawn. The aero flaps shifted into position, transforming the McLaren from beautiful to deadly.
Liam took a deep breath and exhaled slowly, and he smiled. His eyes seem to light up the next moment and he pressed the throttle.
Immediately, the world exploded into a blur as the McLaren lunged forward, tires biting hard into the asphalt as the twin-turbo V8 and hybrid system unleashed 1,150 horsepower.
The exhaust screamed, a metallic wail echoing against the rock faces as Liam tore up the incline.
His Pro-level Vehicular Operation skill came alive and it was complimented by his enhanced senses. His hands moved flawlessly, each shift timed to the millisecond, each corner taken at the perfect angle.
He braked late — impossibly late — yet the car obeyed, diving into apexes like it had read his mind.
The G-forces pinned him to the seat comfortably, with the mountains flashing by in a blur of pine, cliff, and sky.
The road twisted and coiled, but it wasn’t a problem for Liam. He was already going at the car’s top speed but thanks of his enhanced senses, time still felt relatively normal for him.Thɪs
Downshifting into a hairpin, the rear stepped out for a fraction of a second. A lesser driver would have panicked but Liam merely adjusted his steering input, feathered the throttle, and the car snapped back into line, roaring out of the corner with perfect traction.
Liam raced the car throughout the early hours of the morning, through Angeles Crest Highway before finally turning and driving back to the city.
By then, it was already close to noon and Liam has had a ton of fun. It was truly the first time he used his driving skill to its maximum and took advantage of his enhanced senses.
The experience was more than thrilling and he would love to experience it more. But that would for another time as the metal beast needs rest.

chapters.title: Chapter 57: Money Makes The World Go Round
chapters.content:
Chapter 57: Money Makes The World Go Round
Meanwhile, while Liam was racing on Angeles Crest Highway, the internet and the car world was already ablaze with discussion about the sightings of an unknown hypercar in Beverly Hills.
Forums like Reddit (r/cars), FerrariChat, McLarenLife and Supercar Blondie’s page had already blown up with speculations.
Their speculations was just as the same as the two spotters’:
"Is this a secret McLaren Special Operations project?"
"Could it be a prototype for a never-released track car?"
"Is this some Saudi prince’s commission?"
It didn’t help matters that no one has heard about the car before. Normally, even though information about one-offs are classified, there are usually at least whispers about them.
But not so much as a breath was heard about this car before it made its appearance. And that made it even crazier.
The forums weren’t the only ones speculating and talking about the car, as the media also reacted, as outlets like Top Gear, Car Throttle, Bloomberg Auto, Carwow and Robb Report, all ran articles like:
"Mystery McLaren hypercar appears in Los Angeles. Is this a one off?"
They also immediately started chasing McLaren for comments, but unfortunately for them, they will only be chasing after the wind.
Due to the agreement between McLaren and the system, no information about the car, not even a breath of it can be made public.
This leaves the public with no other option but to continue speculating even more.
***
It was already noon by the time Liam pulled back into Rodeo Drive. He slowly drove down the high-end shopping street, not bothering to pay attention to the phones and cameras that were brought and pointed at him immediately he was spotted.
"I only wanted to take the car for a ride," Liam muttered slowly, as he glanced at the groups around him.
He sighed and focused on the road ahead, enjoying the slow drive after the thrilling high speed racing he just had.
The next moment, the car’s integrated system buzzed, announcing an incoming call through the speakers.
Liam looked at the caller ID and he saw that it was an unknown number, but he decided to pick it anyway. He felt that whoever was definitely calling for something important.
"Hello," he said as he picked the call.
"Hello, Mr Liam. This is Janelle from JP Morgan’s Investors Relations," an unfamiliar female voice came from the other end.
Liam wasn’t surprised when he heard that the person was from JP Morgan. He remembered that someone called him the first day he received his first shares of the company.
It’s someone different this time. Is she maybe a senior staff in the investor relations team? Higher in position than Marianne?...
ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ
"What do I owe the pleasure of this call, Miss Janelle?" He asked.
The question was more of a courtesy as they both already knew the reason for the call.
"I’m calling to congratulate you. Your latest acquisition has made you one of JP Morgan’s largest individual shareholders. On behalf of the company, we want to extend our gratitude for your confidence in us," she paused briefly, then continued.
"I will also like to inform you that you’re now a priority investor and now have access to the company’s list of bespoke private clients services. All at the highest tier. You now have dedicated bankers just for you. You have access to investment opportunities before they’re public and also access to special hedge funds, even co-investment deals alongside JPMorgan itself. The highest tier of estate planning, tax optimisation and security services. You will also receive private briefings, early access to reports, and even personal calls about company direction," Janelle said, listing out all of the perks Liam now have access to as one of the company’s top investors.
Liam listened to all this with a smile on his face. It did feel nice hearing that he will be receiving even personal calls about the directons of a multi-billion dollars company like JP Morgan.
It’s only something that money can achieve.
But while it did feel nice to hear, something like that wasn’t something Liam wants to bother himself with.
"Thank you but there’s no need for the briefings and the calls," he said.
"No problem, sir. But if you do need anything, please contact the head of your private banking team, Mr Daniel Conley," Janelle said and continued, "Also, the creation process of your trust has been expedited and will be completed tomorrow. We are very sorry for the delay so far."
"Thank you," Liam said, smiling from ear to ear.
"The pleasure is ours, Mr. Liam. And thank you again for choosing JP Morgan," Janelle said, and politely ended the call.
Liam chuckled softly as he processed everything Janelle had told him.
"I now have a private banking team and the trust has been expedited ahead of time, and it will be ready by tomorrow," he muttered to himself.
Well, it was supposed to be ready during this week, so that’s not much. But the fact that I will receive briefing about the company is a lot.
Who would had actually thought that the same person from two weeks ago that his former employers always worked him to death and still rip him off by paying him pennies, would become the same person that is now qualified to receive briefing about a company that’s top 15 most valuable in the world? Who? No one in their right mind.
It’s just as they say, money makes the world go round.
Liam smiled to himself, his attention on the road ahead.
Barely a minute later, the car’s integrated system buzzed again, announcing an incoming call through the speakers.
He looked at the caller ID and it was another unknown number, but he picked the call nonetheless.
"Hello," he said, as he picked the call.
"Hello, Mr Liam. This is Rachel from Applē’s Investor Relations," an unfamiliar female voice came from the other end.
Liam smiled as he already knew the reason what she was calling, and he decided to say nothing and allow her talk instead.
Rachel noticed Liam’s silence and pressed on.
"Mr. Liam, I’m calling to first congratulate you. With your most recent acquisition, you’ve become one of Applē’s largest individual shareholders. On behalf of the company, we want to extend our warmest welcome and our gratitude for your confidence in us."
She paused briefly, then continued.
""As a priority investor, you’ll have direct access to our executive team, with tailored updates and one-on-one briefings at your discretion. In addition, we’ll be extending invitations to all of our private shareholder events — both here in Cupertino and internationally."
Her voice softened slightly as she continued.
"You’ll also have access to a dedicated liaison — myself, in this case. My role is to ensure your questions are answered promptly, and that your position as a shareholder is supported with all the resources you need. Should you wish to schedule private meetings with our leadership team, including the CFO, or attend closed product showcases ahead of the public, those arrangements can be made as well."
Liam couldn’t hold himself back from smiling from ear to ear, as he listened to Rachel.
"And finally," Rachael added, "given the size of your position, you’re entitled to priority voting rights notifications and private advisory sessions regarding governance issues. Of course, participation is optional, but Applē values the input of stakeholders like you."
She drew in a measured breath. "Mr. Liam, I know that was a lot of information all at once. Would you like me to forward a formal briefing document to your office? Or, if you prefer, I can arrange a private meeting here at Apple Park."
"No. No meeting or briefing. I’m not interested in those things," he simply replied.
"Okay. Please contact me if you need anything."
"I will," Liam said and hung up.
The smile on his face had widened it so much that it was almost giving him wrinkles. Only that wasn’t possible with the nanites in his body.
I could had asked for an iPhone 17 pro max and have it delivered to me ahead of its release date.
Again, money makes the world go round.
Liam slowly pulled into Holmby Hills, with a few cars discreetly following behind him. He didn’t pay attention to them as his thought was on the two calls he had received today.

chapters.title: Chapter 58: Unwanted Attention
chapters.content:
Chapter 58: Unwanted Attention
Liam got out of the car and walked to the garage’s interior door, pulled it open and walked into the mansion.
He walked to the living room and sank into a sofa, letting out a deep sigh. He enjoyed the drive he had just taken.
The thrill he felt when the car was going at its top speed of 255mph was mind blowing. The amazing feeling as he felt from the rush of adrenaline as he did those sharp turns and watched his surroundings flash by in a blur.
It was a really addictive feeling. Like a junkie finally getting his fix. Only now did he truly understand why boys loved drag racing so much, and why movies with top-tier racing scenes never failed to sell.
He enjoyed everything but there was one thing he didn’t enjoy. The attention. When he received the car, he knew that it was something amazing but he had no idea that it will blow up this much, and people would tail him.
The tailing started immediately when he pulled back onto Rodeo Drive. At first, it wasn’t noticeable due to the fact there were other cars around but he started noticing when he pulled into the quieter and more secluded streets of Beverly Hills.
The followed him and only seem to stop a some distance away as he pulled in into Bellemere.
Seems like this is something I will have to get used to if I want to continue driving the LM-X around,
Liam sighed.
He sank further into the sofa as he decided to relax for a while, as he think of what to do next.
As his thoughts were drifting, he heard a notification sound from his phone and he looked at it.
"What the hell?" He frowned slightly, as he picked up his phone.
Harper had sent a message to the group chat and had tagged him. And the content of the message was a screenshot of the bold headline of an online article from a popular site. And under the message was the site’s link.
The headline of the article reads:
P1 LM VARIANT PULLED INTO BELLEMERE MANSION. IS THE NEW OWNER THE SAME PERSON?
Liam clicked on the link and he was immediately taken to the site. And the first thing he saw was the bold headline. He didn’t bother with it, as he scrolled down, reading the content of the article.
"How was many minutes has it been and they have already put out such an article with detailed information? What the hell?" Liam chuckled dryly.
He actually has no idea how to feel right now or what he was feeling exactly. He felt amused, surprised and even scared.
For someone to be able to put together an article with so much information as this in less than five minutes... Liam really has no idea what to say.
It wasn’t just the article but also the images that were attached to it. It was image of the car from different angles. Not only that, but there was an aerial view image of the mansion.
"This people... They are crazy..." Liam muttered slowly, as he took another look at the article.
He noticed that the parts Bellemere Mansion was mentioned were in blue font. He clicked on it and he was taken to another article, and it bold headline reads:
$70M BELLEMERE MANSION PURCHASED BY TEENAGER
"What the...?" Liam muttered slowly, as he started going through the article.
A couple seconds later, he sighed and exited the site. He didn’t want to read anymore as there was nothing for him to see there.
Beside the fact that his name was in the article, the rest of it was just it describing the mansion and its history.
I see... So, that’s why the news about the property sales blew up the way it did.
Liam had no idea that Bellemere Mansion was never up for sale and the previous owner had rejected all the previous offers he received.
Well, that has never been any of my business, has it?
He decided to stop thinking about unnecessary things and focus on the present. But as if fate was against him, his phone buzzed with another notification.
He took a look at it and he saw that he was tagged by Elise in a message she sent in the group chat.
"You got mentioned by Bloomberg!!!" She captioned the message.
The content of the message was an article ran by Bloomberg and its headlines reads:
MYSTERY BUYER OF $70M+ BELLEMERE MANSION SPOTTED DRIVING UNKNOWN MCLAREN HYPERCAR.
Give me a break!,
Liam sighed heavily.
He sent a tired face emoji as reply to the two messages and dropped his phone on the sofa. He never expected his day to go like this. All he wanted to was to just take the car out for a spin!
Liam decided to distract himself by thinking about other things and he remembered that he had planned to make a trip to Geneva, Switzerland during the week, to check the content of the safe deposit box locked away in the Rothschild’s private vault.
"Should I make the trip tomorrow? I can also spend some time over there. Maybe a week?" He thought to himself.
He has planned to go this week but he never decided on a particular day, but he decided that he will make the trip in two days time.
Before he leaves, he wants to prepare himself. The place he’s going to is a private vault that’s ran by one of the biggest families in the world.
Before he goes there, he needs to be at his best in all aspects—physically and mentally.
Liam decided to call David and inform him of his travel plans, so that he can make the necessary arrangements.
***
Meanwhile, in the living area of a certain mansion located in Beverly Hills, there was a tense atmosphere as a young man was being glared at by an older looking male.
"Are you seeing this?" Kevin asked angrily with a deep frown on his face, pointing at the article’s headline displayed on his phone.
The young man being glared at, Jason, lowered his head, with a sullen look on his face.
"F*cking look at me, you selfish, spoilt bastard. You wanted us to go after him? What do you think would had happened if we had gone ahead to do that? Were you trying to destroy out family?" Kevin said with a low voice burning with rage.ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ Novᴇ(l)Fɪre .ɴᴇt
Jason couldn’t say anything. No, he didn’t dare say anything or even raise his head. He knew just how much his second older brother hates his guts and he won’t pass up any opportunity to hit him.
"I once told mom that you will be the one to bring ruin to our family with the way she was spoiling you, and treating you like an egg. Just look at the end result. Take a good look at yourself and tell me what you have managed to achieve," Kevin said, and his voice became even lower.
"Nothing! Besides constituting nuisance everywhere, partying and sleeping around with different girls like a man wh*re. You have achieved absolutely nothing!"
Jason was hurt by Kevin’s word but he didn’t dare say anything and could only bite his lower lip, with his head still lowered.
The next moment, someone walked through the front door and when he noticed the atmosphere in the living area, he sighed.
"Cut him some slack, Kevin. You have already chewed him out enough," Chris said, before walking up the stairs.
Kevin glared at Jason one more time and said, "You really are a piece of work but I will make sure you’re never my problem."
After saying that, he left Jason alone in the living area.
Jason seeing that he was finally alone, sighed heavily in relief and sank into the sofa.
F*ck! Who would had thought that random kid was actually someone of high status? F*ck! F*ck!
"F*ck!!!" He screamed out the last part loudly.
"What’s wrong with my baby boy?" A matured female voice sounded from behind him.
"Nothing, mom," Jason replied.
"Are you sure? If anyone troubled you, just tell me and I will have them dealt with immediately," his mom said.
"No, mom. Nothing happened," Jason said with a smile, as he looked at the beautiful face of his mother.
"That’s good. Always remember that mama is always here for you, baby," his mom said with a smile filled with motherly warmth, before walking up the stairs.
Ahhh... F*ck me sideways.

chapters.title: Chapter 59: Always The Problem
chapters.content:
Chapter 59: Always The Problem
Liam was currently in his room, resting on his bed, gazing at the ceiling, his eyes a little distant as he thought about his upcoming visit to the private vault.
He had already informed Daniel of his travel plans and the fact that he will be visiting the Rothschild’s private vault when he gets there.
Daniel had told him not to worry about anything as he will take care of every single thing, and will give him confirmation before the end of the day.
Liam smiled when he heard this. It did feel nice to just sit back and relax, while someone else take care of everything for him.
It didn’t just feel nice. It was a great feeling.
But the feeling wasn’t what Liam was focused on right now, there was something far more important on his mind.
What do I wear on the day I’m going there? The custom suit should do. It’s high-end enough. I also have two custom watches. One of them will have to do. It’s not like I’m going there to show off or anything. I just need to dress appropriately and look like someone that belongs to their circle.
Liam had tried searching up information on the private vault but he got nothing. This showed him just how secretive they are with it.
He had felt that a place like that will be discreet and access would be very limited, granted only to a selective few. But he no matter now discreet a place is, he never expect that there would be no information about it at all online.
But as always, Liam didn’t overthink it. Also, besides his appearance, he doesn’t need to do anything else as he already the other part covered with his World-Class Etiquette skill.
But he was actually curious about the place and what sort of people he would meet. With just the name, guessing their potential clienteles was very simple.
Royalties and billionaires. In other words, people of high status and wealth.
And while Liam wasn’t in the first category, he has pretty much entered the second.The latest_epɪ_sodes are on_the
"Fuuu," Liam let out a deep breath as he got up from the bed.
Enough of thinking about that place. It’s not like he’s going there immediately he lands in Geneva or the next day. It can wait for now.
There was another thing on his mind beside the trip. It was related to the system points he needs to purchase the molecular assembler.
He had planned that after his second weekly sign-in, he might consider accumulating his sign-ins. And he has done that and thought about it, and he decided that he won’t be accumulating his sign-ins.
The reason for his decision wasn’t because of the rewards—well, they partly influenced his decision. But the main reason was because if he starts accumulating, it would take him much longer to get the remaining amount he needs.
He currently has $77m in cash. Say, he makes it a round figure and he now has $70m, which means he still need $30m.
If he starts accumulating, he will receive 10 SP daily, then an increased amount for weekly, monthly and annually.
But the truth was that it wasn’t even close to being enough. 10 SP is equivalent to $100,000 but he needs $30m more. This means that he will have to accumulate for months before he can get the remaining system points he needs—3,000 SP.
There was no way that he would be wiling to sacrifice months of sign-ins for that. Making a decision like that would had been more difficult for him if the points were higher, but 10 SP wasn’t enough to make him give up on his daily sign-ins.
And the fact that he can get the money he needs much more faster through the sign-ins made him also solidified his decision.
That is decided. Now, where do I place the factory?
Liam intends to create two tech products—the quantum chip and the gaming gear glass. Both techs will be revolutionary to say the least but it will also earn a ton of heat too.
Liam had done his research on the two products and he has come to realised that he’s going to be in for a lot of crazy dramas. And this isn’t an exaggeration as he thought about it and researched it extensively.
First is the quantum chip. Without further explanation, one can already imagine just how crazy the world would go for room temperature quantum chips that are the same size of classic chips in phones and other devices.
But just as the world is going crazy, the company producing the tech and Liam indirectly will be under a lot of heat.
While Liam intends to create the company under the trust so that he can hide his identity and connection to it as its original owner, it doesn’t mean that he won’t feel the heat when things start getting hot.
And how will things get hot? The answer is already obvious, isn’t it? According to Liam’s research, the world’s governments, especially the USA, strictly controls the distribution of high-end specifications GPUs to other countries.
They already labelled it as national security asset and has placed certain embargoes on their exportation into certain countries—non-allied states obviously.
Now, imagine what they will do when a tech that’s at least 100x better than the most advanced high specification GPU in the world, gets released.
Labelling it as national security asset would be the tip of the iceberg. They will want outright control of it. Heck, they will go beyond restricting the tech to the country, nationalise it and make it American.
Liam loves his country. Don’t get him wrong on that but restricting something that’s his isn’t something he will ever be in support of.
But the problem wasn’t just the US government but all governments around the world. They will scramble for the tech and will do anything at all to acquire it.
But the truth is that the problem isn’t the government. It has never been them. The problem is the mega corporations that the mere existence of the tech threatens everything they have built.
Take for example, the current most valuable company in the world that literally has the world in its palm because of their GPU. Even with the restrictions placed on them by the US, they are still making a killing in profits.
Then there are the old guards of the tech industries, the unshakable heavyweights that will quiver in their boots when the tech hits the market.
And it’s not just the tech industry but the entire Fortune 500 companies that will be threatened. And they will do what they do best, they will lobby against the company, forcing the government to take action.
And that’s where the heat will come. This was just for the quantum chip. Now, what about the gear glass? That’s where things gets even crazier.
Liam had already played out different scenarios in his head and at the end, he decided that he would go ahead with creating the techs.
He has visualised near countless scenarios and there was no way to hide from the chaos he will bring upon the world with the techs. There are the good sort of chaos and the dark sort, but at the end, the issue isn’t with him but the world itself.
At the end, we are always the problem.

chapters.title: Chapter 60: The World’s Madness
chapters.content:
Chapter 60: The World’s Madness
The day for Liam passed faster or slower. He spent it doing nothing at home but chatting with his friends, and watching movies in the mansion’s private theatre.
He was naturally bombarded with questions by the boys as they asked him about the car and its specifications. Even the girls were curious about the car.
Liam didn’t hold back as he gave them the juicy details they wanted. He told them the name of the car, its specifications and every other details.
While these details were juicy, what actually interested the boys was the car’s top speed and when he told them that it’s255mph1 , they were very impressed.
255mph already puts the car among the fastest cars in the world and it even beats McLaren previous record of 250mph. It can actually be said that it’s one of their best hypercars yet.
But unfortunately for the public, it’s a one-off. If it wasn’t, they will definitely want to get their hands on it.
At least, that was what the boys were thinking until they heard the price. $7m wasn’t amount they will be able to splurge on cars that easily or even ever.
Unlike Liam that has access to unlimited wealth and has unlimited spending power, they don’t have that. They are at the mercy of their families and there was no way that they can save up their allowances to get a car of that amount. It was close to impossible.
The boys couldn’t help but feel a little depressed but that was all to it. If at all, they were actually happy and that was for two reasons.
The first reason was for Liam. They share in his happiness too. Getting a one-off commission means a lot and it can be said to the dream of nearly every car lover.
The second reason was because they can beg Liam to allow them take the car out for a ride. Though they have no idea if he will agree to it.
But you know what they always say? You never know until you try.
They will give it a try first.
As for Liam’s identity, at this point, there was no more debating it. A $70m+ mansion, private chopper of $20m+, a luxury super yacht of $300m+ and one-off commissioned car of $7m. .
If he’s not from a crazy billionaire family, then he’s probably the secret controller of the world’s economy. But even they feel that even if there’s the chance that he’s theoretically the world’s economy, he still shouldn’t be able to splurge so much.
According to their calculation, he has spent more than $500m in two weeks. That’s an insane amount of money to splurge even for billionaire families.
But they were also aware that Liam would only keep being more mysterious to them as they days passed, though that didn’t matter to them. They might never get to find out which family he comes from but they were happy just being his friends.
Even if he’s not from a powerful family or a billionaire family, and he’s as ordinary as the report say, it won’t change anything as he’s someone they deeply connect with.
But as for him being ordinary, that was impossible. If he’s from an ordinary background, then they and others like them have no background at all.
As for Liam, the chat wasn’t the highlight of his day but the fact that he got the confirmation from Daniel as promised. He has expected to get it somewhat later in the evening but he got it almost an hour after the call.
Maybe because of his now higher VIP status, they made the preparations faster. Or maybe it was because the place he’s visiting in Geneva was the Rothschild private vault.
Yes, Liam told Daniel that the reason for his visit to Geneva. It wasn’t something he could keep to himself as they were also no need for it.
By informing Daniel, Liam already have everything taken care of. As the leader of his private banking team, he will call the private vault and make the necessary arrangements for Liam’s visit.
The private vault isn’t some place Liam can just waltz into and expect to get attended to. He has to follow protocols. If he doesn’t call ahead and provide means for identification so that the organisation can prepare, then they won’t attend to him.
When Liam thought of the amount of stress Daniel has saved him from, he smiled. He really loves the easy life he’s living now. It’s the immesurable amount of comfort that money can get you. The right amount of money to be precise.
But the best highlight of his day was the fact that the trust was ready. Janelle had told him that it will ready by tomorrow but it was ready by dinnertime.
With the trust ready, Liam can proceed with things related to his future company. He had actually told Daniel to start creating it and it should be ready in five days.Tʜe sourcᴇ of thɪs content ɪs novᴇl(ꜰ)ire.ɴet
It naturally shouldn’t take that long but the company can’t be created directly. It has to be created under a holding company like an LLC, then the tech company will be slotted under it as a subsidiary. That way, it will be harder for people trying to dig to into the company owner’s identity in the future.
As for Liam, he wasn’t exactly in a hurry to start pumping out the tech into the market yet. He had actually taken the whole of the day to think about the two techs.
As for the result of that? He decided against launching the quantum chip publicly. He will create it but use it personally for something else.
The reason for the change was because he has thought about it and he felt that just the gear glass would be more than enough. There was no need releasing the chip publicly.
Wasn’t Liam trying to limit himself by doing this? Isn’t this against his character? The answer to both was no.
The gear glass’ something that will disrupt the tech market more than the chip would and also destabilise the world. Also, releasing just it will help him to contain the dark things people will try to perpetrate with his technology.
With the functions Liam already have planned in mind for the gear glass, it’s going to be the biggest tech in the world for possibly decades to come.
And the fact that replicating it in any form would be something impossible, would also make the tech even bigger.
This is going to be the same for the chip if he’s going to release it. He will make hundreds of billions from just selling it. That was an amount of potential profit no corporation will ever give up. But Liam can.
He had already played scenarios in his head of the chip being used to create very advanced weapons, engineer extremely deadly bioweapons and all other sort of things. And that was what the reason why he’s going to be giving up the profit.
His intention for both techs was for them to be used for the advancement of the human civilisation. But if they are going to indirectly make him an arms dealer, then he will just keep the chip to himself.
He could stomach greed, envy, even government control. But blood? Absolutely no way. If his technology ever became the reason children died in some war zone or the reason why a deadlier version of the previous pandemic breaks out again, that stain would never wash off.
There’s the question of if the gear glass can also be militarised and used to create the advanced weapons and lethal bioweapons he’s so much against. The answer to that question is yes and no.
It’s yes in the sense that the government will definitely want a military version of it. But no, because Liam’s company will refuse to create that version for them.
They will naturally pressure the company if he refuses but he won’t cave no matter what. But Liam understands that even if he resists, they will still try to find a way around it.
This is the reason for Liam’s next plan: creating a quantum ecosystem. Since they are so stubborn and won’t listen, he will give them what they want in different form and in a way he can control the creation of things like that however he wants.
The idea for the quantum ecosystem is still fresh in his mind and he’s still refining it. It will probably take him the rest of the night to refine it completely.
Ahhh... I really don’t understand why things like weapons has to exist. Just unnecessarily complicating things for me. You fucking people,
Liam sighed, making himself even more comfortable in his already ultra comfortable bed.
Sometimes he wondered if humanity would destroy itself even without him. Weapons always found a way to exist. Always. And yet here he was, forced to plan around their madness.
